availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Bell (Barren County, KY, captain, AQM, and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Maria Bell. Resident of Barren County in 1850. Household owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Barren County in 1850. Resident of Barren County in 1860. Household under the name of G. M. Procter (second husband of his mother, Maria Bell Procter) owned fourteen enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private from October 11, 1861. Transferred to 9th KY Cavalry and appointed first lieutenant, captain, and assistant quartermaster until May 1865. Paroled at Washington, Georgia, on May 10, 1865. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 2-3.
